document.masterDocTitle: Stenopodidean shrimps (Crustacea: Decapoda) from New Caledonian waters

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 .
Spongicola andamanicus Alcock, 1901
. A, B, F, female, MNHN-Na11981; C, male, MNHN-Na 11962; D, E, female, MNHN-Na 11962. A, female; B, E, carapace, dorsal view; C, D, carapace, lateral view; F, telson & uropods. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.

FIGURE 4 .
Spongicola andamanicus Alcock, 1901
. A–K, N, O. male MNHN-Na 11975; L. female, MNHN-Na 11962; M. male, MNHN-Na 11962. A, lateral view, carapace and abdomen; B, epistome and labrum, ventral view; C, left mandible, dorsal view; D, maxillule; E, maxilla; F, first maxilliped; G, second maxilliped; H, third maxilliped; J, second pereiopod; K, right third pereiopod; L, left third pereiopod; M, left third pereiopod; N, fourth pereiopod; O, fifth pereiopod. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.

Measurements (mm). Females, PCL: 2.5–6.3 ; RCL: 3.0– 8.7 ; TL: 8.2–21.6 . Males, PCL: 2.4–5.2 ; RCL: 3.2– 8.6 ; TL: 7.8 –20.0. Eggs few in number ( 7–94 ); those in early stages of development averaged 0.15 × 0.17 mm , those in late stages of development averaged 1.04 × 0.98 mm .
Distribution . Andaman Sea, Hawaii, Japan , Philippines , Indonesia , Fiji , Vanuatu , Australia , Madagascar , Loyalty Islands, and New Caledonia .

Coloration . Color notes accompanying specimen MNHN-Na 11968 : carapace and abdomen whitish with numerous pink chromatophores; tail fan with reddish spines; eyes black; scaphocerite transparent outlined in pink; antennae transparent outlined in white; mouthparts and legs salmon pink; and third pereiopod whitish mostly with pink chromatophores and pink outline, dactylus mostly pink.

Hosts . This species has been found several times in the sponge
Pheronema semiglobosum
.

Remarks . This species was thoroughly described by
Saito & Komai ( 2008 )
and is not redescribed here. The mouthparts are illustrated here as well as some variation in the spination of the third pereiopod (
Figs. 4
B–H, 4 K– M).
Saito & Komai ( 2008 )
also reported on additional records of this species from New Caledonia (Jumeau Bank, Norfolk Ridge, and Banc Stylaster).
